pullRequest.body:
prove basic result that such a space is topologically zero dimensional

leave todos for future directions


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b7666fdc52](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22580/commits/b7666fdc5211095f26b70185ec20e3ed6671d0fb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.UniformSpace.Ultra` (new file)|624|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsTransitiveRel`
`+ IsTransitiveRel.comp_eq_of_idRel_subset`
`+ IsUltraUniformity`
`+ _root_.TopologicalSpace.isTopologicalBasis_clopens`
`+ nhds_basis_clopens`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

**[lint-bib (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion title = {Equivalent characterizations of non-Archimedean uniform spaces}, ```

Should this stay here? Or move to some basic file on sets?
Also, should the name be `IsTransitiveRel`?

I followed the style in `UniformSpace/Defs.lean` which has the following explanation and defs
```
There is already a theory of relations in `Data/Rel.lean` where the main definition is
`def Rel (α β : Type*) := α → β → Prop`.
The relations used in the current file involve only one type, but this is not the reason why
we don't reuse `Data/Rel.lean`. We use `Set (α × α)`
instead of `Rel α α` because we really need sets to use the filter library, and elements
of filters on `α × α` have type `Set (α × α)`.
[...]
/-- The relation is invariant under swapping factors. -/
def SymmetricRel (V : Set (α × α)) : Prop :=
  Prod.swap ⁻¹' V = V
```
Is that true ?? I don't have much experience with that kind of axioms so I believe you, but I would have expected that the statement would be "for some distance inducing the same uniformity"!
Could you add as an intermediate step that `IsTransitiveRel s` is equivalent to `s ○ s ⊆ s` ? And then deduce this as an iff?
Could you provide a constructor taking any basis made of equivalence relations?

Could you break this down into:
- balls for transitive relations are open
- balls for equivalence relations are disjoint (or equal)
- balls for equivalence relations are clopen
- and then this result follows almost immediately using [nhds_basis_uniformity'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/Defs.html#nhds_basis_uniformity') (more precisely this gives you *a* basis of clopen sets, and then [Filter.HasBasis.to_hasBasis'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Bases/Basic.html#Filter.HasBasis.to_hasBasis') finishes the job)

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/UniformSpace): define nonarchimedean uniformity

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology): rename to `IsSymmetricRel` to indicate prop nature
